bibl.title: A Ration-Warrant for an "adiutor memoria".
bibl.note: Latin text with Greek subscription. Caesarea (in Palestine?), but found somewhere in Egypt, 6 Dec. 293. The papyrus brings support to the demonstration that Galerius went to Egypt near the end of 293 to put down a revolt in the Thebaid. The "adiutor memoriae" is attested here for the first time.
Rea John R., Robert P. Salomons and Klaas A. Worp, A Ration-Warrant for an "adiutor memoria".
Naphtali Lewis (Ed.), Papyrology = YCS 28 (1985) pp. 101-113 et pl. VIII.
